flows.name: SRH - Navigation - Contraceptives - vasectomy tips

actions.text: A vasectomy is a permanent procedure where a male's vas deferens (tubes that carry sperm) are cut ✂️ and tied to prevent sperm from mixing into semen. If there is no sperm when a man releases 💦, pregnancy cannot happen.
quick_replies: Can a female still get pregnant if a man has a vasectomy?
Can you still have normal sex if the man has a vasectomy?

flows.name: SRH - Navigation - Contraceptives - Tubal ligation tips

actions.text: Female sterilization, aka tubal ligation, tying tubes or tie off, is when a female's fallopian tubes (tubes that lead to eggs in the ovaries) are tied or cut ✂️ to prevent sperm 💦 from ever meeting eggs so pregnancy cannot happen. This is a permanent procedure and only recommended for older women who have already had children.
quick_replies: Who can get a tie off?
Can a female still get pregnant if her tubes are tied?
